name: treatment of residues, MSWI[F]-WWT, WW from ceramic production, residual material landfill | residues, MSWI[F]-WWT, WW from ceramic production | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25411/documentation

The process represents the treatment of a waste (residues) that is exclusively produced from another waste treatment. Residues are generated in the municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI) of sewage sludge (with 70% water) that in turn is generated from wastewater treatment (WWT) of 'wastewater from ceramic production'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'wastewater from ceramic production'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to surface water and long-term emissions to ground water).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters affecting the treatment technology are specific to this geography and to the technology mix encountered in Switzerland in 2012.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Residual material landfill for polluted, inorganic waste with base seal and leachate collection system. Recultivation after closure.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Modelling parameters are based on an average residual material landfill in Switzerland.
